website_summaries.verdict: A soft case that still offers a lot of protection as well as storage options.
pros: Opens flat and fits standard acoustic guitars up to 41 inches long
Neck support pillow provides additional padding and security for the neck of the guitar
Has 2 pockets for accessories, adjustable shoulder straps, 2 carrying handles, and a name window
cons: High quality for a soft case, but doesn't offer as much protection as a hard case

customer_reviews.title: The padding is very good and the exterior storage compartments are quite roomy
customer_reviews.text: The only reasonably priced gig bag which will fit my Fender Jazz Bass. Every other bag I own is strained at the zipper due to the width of the upper bout. The padding is very good and the exterior storage compartments are quite roomy. I finally have enough room for a notebook, sheet music, strap, cord and tuner. Fender bags ( I own two ) are not as well made, have thinner padding, are constructed of thinner material and were more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: F. Clef

customer_reviews.title: Zippers WILL fail.
customer_reviews.text: Well, I must say that I was kind of disappointed. But, the Old saying goes.. "You get what you pay for." The padding, and the spacing was perfect for my Kingston Ksd 5, but had a near heart attack when the zipper came apart, and my Bass slid out. Zipper came apart on first use, on both the main, and the compartments. Disappointing seeing how, all I had in it was my Bass, Strap, small tool case, and a pack of strings. In a nut shell, if you love you Bass, NOT your choice. Sad though, looked promising, until it was used.
customer_reviews.author: Rhome

customer_reviews.title: Not the same value as the Hola Music bag bought a year ago😟
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't deserve to have the Hola Music label😞 To save on cost the bag has less material in several spots. It is not as wide on the sides,the pockets are smaller and narrower,even the I'd holder has been changed to a cheap sleeve instead of a nice hard plastic slide out panel ( that part added extra protection ) Overall it an ok bag but is not the quality and value that the older version was. Unfortunately corporate greed to save on the bottom line is like a disease any more😠
customer_reviews.author: Mr XTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Compared to more expensive gig bags...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this gig bag for my grandson for a Christmas gift so make no mistake, I did my homework and checked out way more expensive bags online and physically inspected more expensive gig bags. This Bag compared very favorably to other bags and in most cases it was superior to more expensive bags. I would recommend this bag to anyone. And it really is backed up by the manufacturer. I received an email immediately after I received the bag and they really do want you to be happy with their product. I seldom right reviews on products that I purchase but I was so impressed with the bag and the manufacturer that I felt compelled to write this.
customer_reviews.author: mpard

customer_reviews.title: it's all of good quality and well put together
customer_reviews.text: I was hopeful after reading the comments, and from what I can tell so far, the hype is well deserved. Both my strat and my les paul fit very well within this bag. The zipper, the lining, it's all of good quality and well put together. Sometimes businesses put less effort into their lower cost products but this isn't the case with this Hola! gig bag. I absolutely recommend this bag to anyone on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Welsh

customer_reviews.title: This is a great bag!
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased with the material and construction. It does NOT have a logo on the front of the bag, which in my opinion makes it better, just a small tag off to one side. Nice pouch on the neck portion for a footrest, which is tight but it fits. I was a little surprised that the padded neck support inside is removable, I probably missed that somewhere in the description. Seems like the velcro on the neck support is not in the right place to make sure it stays in position, but it hasn't been an issue. My kid really loves the backpack straps. Very happy with my purchase, would recommend to anyone looking for an affordable quality gig bag.
customer_reviews.author: bigjohn322

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this as a gift for my husband's Epiphone WildKat semi-hollow body electric guitar. I made sure to measure everything to make sure this would fit. All the measurements seemed to be correct but then it came in and he tried to put his guitar in it and it didn't fit. The measurements provided in the description seem to be the OUTSIDE measurements and not the INSIDE so it was just a touch off. But that's ok because it DID fit his other guitar and he still loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: Fits Ibanez RG450EXB perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Fits my Ibanez RG450EXB perfectly. More padded than I expected and lightweight. It's pretty comfortable to carry in my hand or with the shoulder straps. The zippers feel all right, but mine tend to pull and get a little caught on the curve of the bag. It doesn't look or feel like it'll break, but it could be smoother. The pockets are very useful for books and cables. I don't have my pedals with me at the moment, but they'd probably transport fine in them, too. Pretty solid little gig bag and ideal for traveling in my car.
customer_reviews.author: AlyCat

customer_reviews.title: Product as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This bag has a good layer of protection and the neck strap keeps the guitar in place - big plus. You can also put quite a bit additional in the pockets. Only down side is the consistent emails since purchasing and delivery for me to review the product. At least it is an honest review and not a paid review. Would I buy again, yes if I am in the market for a budget priced case. It did survive a flight in the carry on luggage cabin with a carry on bag next to it. Please insure the guitar to fly with peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Decent

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, lightweight case which fit a Cordoba II mini bass
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in hopes it would hold my brand new Cordoba II mini bass. Turns out, it is an absolutely perfect fit. I especially like the padded neck support. When I ordered the case, it listed an arrival time of weeks away. However, a day after ordering it, I received an email saying it was already on its way! Delivery was super fast and the packing was a very sturdy box, which is now a temporary playhouse for our kitties. They absolutely love their new gift!
customer_reviews.author: Pixie Wright

customer_reviews.title: Totally satisfied. Great well thought out, quality guitar case at a low price.
customer_reviews.text: Great guitar case for the money. It is well thought out. My old bag cost more than 2x this one. It was not heavily padded, this one stands on its own. This has extra protection over tuner and bridge so strings dont cut bag. My old one did not. Inside tore apart then white stuffing fell into classical tuners and got in gears. It opens all the way around the other was 2/3 which made it hard to get guitar in and out. Loved the 2 outside zippered storage areas. Friend saw it, loved it and will be ordering one.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney A Roderick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value, perfect for my needs-
customer_reviews.text: This soft-case is an awesome value--it's well constructed, has a tons of additional storage space (which I don't use much but probably most people do), and is super affordable without giving up quality. I don't need one that is super-reinforced, because I realized that my guitar is always either stored safely in my car, is on my shoulder or sitting next to me at the airport, or is in an over-head. Why would I need to pay for extreme protection if that isn't my need? Having said that, this offers suitable protection for my needs, and I was quite happy to find it on Amazon. Super-fast delivery too-
customer_reviews.author: FYHIII

customer_reviews.title: Great bag at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Great bag at a great price. At first I wasn't sure I wanted to buy it because of the big "Hola! Music" logo on it (nothing against the company, I just didn't like how it looked,) BUT I was pleasantly surprised after getting it out of the box that the logo isn't on the bag at all. I'm not sure if maybe it's an old model or new model bag, but either way it was a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Brutal_NH

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY .. Hola! Music is the one
customer_reviews.text: I have been shopping for weeks for the right gig bag for my Washburn T24 bass <44"long> that would protect my instrument, mind you, I only take it to Church & back home however; I have purchased and returned three (3) bags previously because the sellers misrepresent their quality, NOT Hola! Music. Adam provided a video which responded to every concern I had, what a blessing, this bag protects my instrument in every manner. Best of all, Adam personally followed up to insure I was completely satisfied . . well I am exrtremely elated so much so that I will probably buy another for my NY Carlo Robelli bass. What a blessing, I say...OLE! to Hola! Music.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value!!!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth more than they're charging, I'm supremely happy I bought this case! Stop searching for a better price, you probably won't find it. I spent hours looking for a study case to for my 46" electric bass (from top of headstock to bottom of body.) The backpack straps adjust low enough that the top of your instrument won't be so high that you have to worry about doorways. (I'm 5'10" so that's important to me.) I could rave more but long reviews tend to get passed over. Exactly as pictured. Thanks Hola Music!
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Stoessel

customer_reviews.title: Great quality at a low price point!
customer_reviews.text: This bag carries my Fender, Yamaha, and Ibanez basses without issue. I bought this bag for quick and easy transport to smaller gigs and rehearsals. It is very sturdy with a neck brace that is very handy. The storage compartments fit my cords, tuners, wrenches and other misc items without feeling bloated of overloaded. The bottom has a very cleverly placed protector that allows you to rest the case on the ground without damaging the bottom of your bass while you pack and unpack. And the price is perfect! I can’t say if it’s durable or not since I’ve only had it for 2 months but it is very good in all other aspects.
customer_reviews.author: Philip A Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Economy-Priced Option
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it's supposed to; the padding feels very sufficient for a gig bag, and the zippers seem okay for the price range. Can't ask for much more and the bag looks nice with a clean-cut appearance–––nothing too extravagant. I also own the electric guitar variant, which also seems to be holding its own just fine. Highly recommend this company for the price and quality you receive.
customer_reviews.author: The Great Gonzo

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This bag seems very well constructed.i am able to fit all my gear into the bag. I've used the bag now twice since I got it ( doesnt seem like much but I've had it for three days) . But I am very happy with it. I believe this is going to be a good gig bag for me ! Zippers and everything about this bag seem like it was put together quite well. Would I buy it again ? Yes I would ! Don't think I'll have to anytime soon tho because I think it will last me a long time !!! Buy it and enjoy it !!! I am !
customer_reviews.author: John A.

customer_reviews.title: Good case for the money
customer_reviews.text: I really like this case so far. The backpack straps and zippers seem a bit cheap to me, but overall the bag has served its purpose so far as a commuter guitar bag. I like the pockets and overall style and size.
customer_reviews.author: C Drury

customer_reviews.title: Just Right
customer_reviews.text: As described. Pretty good padding (15mm). Straps, zippers all seem fine. To get another 5mm of padding (at another onliner) would have doubled the price. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars had to do with the packaging. The box measured (in inches) 52x29x6. Whereas, the gig bag is about 38x15x3. There was absolutely nothing else, not even packing, in the box. Seems like a waste.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT fit Acoustic Bass Guitar
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the bass case for my acoustic bass guitar, but quickly found out that it does NOT fit an acoustic bass. The body was way too big for the bag and I was sorely disappointed because the bag itself seems like great quality. Side note, there was a random cube inside the bag when it arrived and I'm not really sure what it's for. The zipper was inside out and it had velcro on it. Not really sure of its use... Would've loved the bag had it actually fit the body. Length was fine.
customer_reviews.author: MRMB

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for under $30.
customer_reviews.text: Bag is good. I have a small body guitar (FS800 Yamaha) and fits with some extra slack space. The padding is good, comfortable straps and pockets enough to fit accessories and a book. The only thing I was not happy about was the advertising. The original price is $69 something and is being sold for $29. The bag quality is definitely not worth $69.
customer_reviews.author: HR

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Guitar Case!!!
customer_reviews.text: 37 years of playing guitars in bands and various venues and lugging around different guitar cases, this case is awesome. Superior quality and very well made with many features a soft guitar case should have. This can hold any one of the guitars that I own. I am so impressed with this product that I'm going to buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Ray

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gig bag & excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: The bag is well built and well padded. I use it for travelling with my bass guitar and have no worries about damaging the guitar. I especially like the added neck support built into the bag. The case had a small defect from the factory, I contacted their customer service department and they addressed the problem to my satisfaction. Will definitely buy from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Greentre

customer_reviews.title: Good 3/4 size bag.
customer_reviews.text: I finally got the second order of this bag; the first one got lost in transport to me. This bag is a good fit for my guitar. My guitar dimensions are: 35.375 x 12.375 x 4.0 inches. This bag's padding is thick but soft. The pockets unzip from 3/4 of the width down to 3/4 of the hight. So, you have to insert items in from the corner of the pockets. I am happy with my purchase. If it falls apart in the near future, I will let you know.
customer_reviews.author: JSB

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my HB Fretless bass
customer_reviews.text: I needed a sturdy case for my new Harley Benton JB40 FL SB fretless bass. I won't travel with it much, but it is a super heavy bass, so I figured a good gig bag would do. This case fit it perfectly, and is well made. For my moderate use, I expect it to last for years. I have bought Hola products before, and always find them to be high quality while reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Frontman1955

customer_reviews.title: Insanely practical!
customer_reviews.text: Why did I wait so long to buy one? I can sling it over my shoulders and have both hands free. Lots of room in side pockets for papers, chords, pics, extra strings, etc. Durable, and has a nice phone block with Velcro to steady the neck inside. For storage and the bulk of my transportation needs, this beats my hardshell case hands down.
customer_reviews.author: gadgetman

customer_reviews.title: Very surprising case.
customer_reviews.text: I was very much surprised by the quality of this bag for its price point. I wasn't expecting the nylon or the zippers to be as robust as they were, nor was I expecting it to have the near perfect dimensions for the guitar I was putting in it. This was the first product I've purchased from Hola, but it won't be the last.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: A bargain good gig bad!
customer_reviews.text: You can tell the quality of a gig bad by simply seeing if it stands up without folding over. This one does. Good padding, sturdy construction, and plenty of storage here. It will fit the largest of electric basses, mine is a semi hollow Ibanez that needs at least 3" depth. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Roadog66

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality nicely padded with neck support gig bag
customer_reviews.text: Good overall quality case with subtle looks and a decent amount of padding. Zippers work well and has storage for the basics Perfect for home use. Might want something a little more heavy duty for taking to lessons or for gigging. A good option over less expensive gig bags that have less padding. Neck support cushion can be adjusted some and Velcro neck strap hold guitar in place firmly.
customer_reviews.author: DJB

customer_reviews.title: A good Bass gig bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a good Bass gig bag the only problem is the Zipper on pouch to store you wire and Picks separated after the first use. I was very disappointed because I had high hopes for it. Good padding but very cheap zippers. If the company uses a better quality zipper it would have received a better grade....
customer_reviews.author: Scott a. Duryea

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Fits my dreadnaught perfectly. I love the large front pocket that is big enough to hold a full notebook and the neck pocket also fits a strap. Has some style not seen in most of the less expensive bags. I also like the headstock padding with velcro to secure the guitar while inside. I'd buy another....but I need another guitar first!!
customer_reviews.author: margaritaking

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: In theory this bag has enough storage for your picks, strap, extra strings, cables. After 2 months the zipper broke and the bag started showing signs of tears even though I’ve only used it lightly to take my bass from show to show and it always rested in the back seat of my car. It felt cheap but i guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Well made gig bag!
customer_reviews.text: This gig bag has great padding, is well made, has all kinds of features (pockets for chords, sheet music, etc., adjustable backpack straps, handles everywhere), has a great support for the neck and fits my 3/4 acoustic guitar like a glove. The bag arrived quickly and packaged well. I just love it and would highly recommend it if you have the need. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: ceej2014

customer_reviews.title: Good for light use, get something better for moderate use.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for here. Love this bag, but it is completely falling apart with moderate use (2-3 times a week) after less than a year. If you plan on only using this lightly, buy it, otherwise pay for something a little more sturdy. Also lacking pockets within the pockets, so all your picks and everything get all lumped together at the bottoms of the pockets. Lucky I caught the bottom hole before my bass fell out, about to duck tape this guy up until my heavier duty one comes.
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best case of it's class (gig bag)
customer_reviews.text: Excellent case, especially for it's price. Not as 'smug' as I thought it would be; being a gig-bag rather than a hard case, there's not going to be as much support for the neck--but the included 'neck rest' certainly does help. Would have been nice to have velcro loops (or similar) to secure lead cables in the large pouch. Still, as mentioned, a very good case for it's price!
customer_reviews.author: void presence

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! ☺
customer_reviews.text: Spent a lot of time looking for the right bag for my full size guitar. This one is a perfect fit and I love the neck support and plenty of padding to keep it safe and secure. The outside pockets are quite spacious and hold my music and accessories with room to spare. This case is very well made at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: S E

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Guitar Bag
customer_reviews.text: Been using this guitar bag for my full size acoustic guitar. The quality is great, it is completely padded from inside, protecting the guitar from any falls/hits. It gives lot of storage as well, I can keep my tablet, my notes and additional guitar gears in the storage and it will hold all with over filling it. I would recommend this to all guitarists!
customer_reviews.author: Ladu Birla

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy case
customer_reviews.text: This is a great carrying case. We got 2 to use with a Dean Palomino and a Yamaha FSX700SC. The fit is really good, all of the handles are very well stitched, the guitars feel very secure when carrying and the padding is better than I expected! The only thing I would change is to move the pad for the neck higher, but it’s Velcro so I’ll probably add an extra piece so I can move it up, no big deal and personal preference. The Dean guitar is about 4 1/2” thick and is easily zipped up.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Nice bag, fits my Samick Strat well. Straps work great, okay storage capacity. Two complaints: 1) I'd like a smaller pocket somewhere to hold my picks / small stuff, and 2) I wish there was a little more relief for the whammy-bar... I have to take the handle off when carrying with books.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag worth the money,
customer_reviews.text: I needed a bag for a dreadnought and wanted a good one. This has thicker padding than others, appears well made, has a padded neck rest which is a big plus, and reflective material on the outside. It was worth the few extra dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Musicman

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I did a fair amount of shopping around and this bag delivers solid quality at a good price. Plus, I got free shipping, which more expensive bags didn't offer. I've only had the bag for a few weeks and had call to use it once, but I can tell I'll have this for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Norbert the Llama

customer_reviews.title: Great case
customer_reviews.text: I use this for a Les Paul style electric guitar. It fits well and the guitar neck is well supported. There are a lot of detailed considerations that went into this gig bag. Watch the video from the manufacturer for all the details. I think this gig bag is great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Thick, Light Case You Can Trust
customer_reviews.text: Needed a lightweight case to drag my bass to practice and gigs. I have always been afraid to move away from hard cases for fear of damaging my gear. Took a chance on this case due to the cheap price and solid reviews. Glad I did, because this thing is thick and has and amazing neck support (with a Velcro strap) that I trust to keep my bass safe. You would have to do something extremely careless to damage you instrument using this case.
customer_reviews.author: string33

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to have a way to keep my ESP LTD EC-1000 safe from dust and nicks at home. As another reviewer mentioned, the guitar fits without room to spare. It has a decent amount of padding. I would not recommend it for gigging or extensive travelling, but for light duty use it is perfectly adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Eldritch

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Bag!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic gig bag for bass guitars! I has all the straps in the right places to carry it a variety of ways, it fits my bass perfectly, and the pockets in the front are exactly the right size and shape for sheet music, cables, eye glasses and a host of other uses. Really well made! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: RomanStJames

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing deal.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag to protect one of my guitars for a move from Virginia to Alabama. I was impressed by the padding, not to mention a little foam neck rest near the top inside, which has a velcro strap to keep your axe really secure. I didn't have room to take my guitars with me, so they were packed and moved with everything else. I taped two moving boxes together, wrapped everything with a comforter, and held my breath. The Hola! bag can hold its own with the best of them. I'd put it up against Fender gig bags any day of the week.
customer_reviews.author: Lilith Moradian

customer_reviews.title: This bag is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I am so impressed with my new Hola 3/4 guitar bag! It is very well made, with thick padding and neck support. I like the extra handle on the face side, and the zippered storage is surprisingly large. Not at all what I was expecting, the word 'bag' implies flimsyness and this is anything but flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: AnnieC

customer_reviews.title: A well thought out gig bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Gretsch which has a LP style single cut body and angled headstock. The neck support block is perfect for keeping the headstock away from the back of the case where it could sustain damage. The handles are all exactly where I wanted them, and the case even fully unzips to make it easy to remove and put the guitar back away. This case is a great value and has everything I was looking for in a gig bag.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for my guitar & travels
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this gig bag shortly before taking my guitar to Columbia. The shoulder straps were comfortable through airports, and it even felt secure on my back while climbing around on rocks at the beach. I liked its protective padding & heavy-duty feel. Thankfully my flights had room in their front closet because I don't think it would've handled suitcases in the baggage compartment (but I wouldn't expect any gig bag to handle that). Extra handles were convenient, and the large front pocket fit my 1" binder nicely. Thanks! :-)
customer_reviews.author: A. T.

customer_reviews.title: Fits Guitar perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves it! Fits his guitar perfectly and he was so excited to see it came with free lessons! The customer service is awesome too!! I've received a couple emails from the company letting know it was on it's way AND a follow up one just making sure I was happy.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Light but great protection for your guitar.
customer_reviews.text: This guitar case is really great. I got it for a 7 year old buddy who just got his first guitar. It has both a small pocket and a larger pocket for music, pics and capos. The strap that goes over the guitar neck keeps it from sliding around in the case. It has 2 handles as well as "back pack style" straps to carry it over the shoulders. Big plus is that the zippers are durable and very easy to use. I strongly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ken B

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic products and service!
customer_reviews.text: I got the bag for my son’s new guitar a few days before the guitar arrived. I thought it was an awesome bag, and great quality. However when the guitar arrived, I realized the bag was too small. I went to return and there was a problem with the prime return. So I reached out to hola music, and the quickly.... seriously within minutes... responded and made it right. They blew me away. I immediately ordered another bag from them that I think will be perfect for the guitar. I highly recommend this company and their products. I haven’t seen service like this in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Cereal Mom

customer_reviews.title: The pockets and handles/straps are great, and the case protects my bass well
customer_reviews.text: The pockets and handles/straps are great, and the case protects my bass well. It would be a 4-5 star review, except that after 2 months of light use, the zipper track is a bit separated such that is difficult to open and close the case. I have no idea how this came about, as I have not subjected this case to any abuse over this time. I was hoping to get years out of this thing, and only two months of functional use is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M

customer_reviews.title: Great neck support for so little money
customer_reviews.text: For less than $35, I have a bass gig bag with a neck support pillow and a velcro strap. The pillow is what sold me on this bag, keeping the tuning keys away from the bottom shell. This bag is fairly sturdy, roomy, and lightweight for my Yamaha Rbx250ii.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick and JoAnn Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great Gig Bag!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is perfect for my needs. It is padded enough to offer considerable protection but is also light and comfortable to carry. It has some nice extra features like extra padding and velcro strap for the neck of the guitar, handles on both the side and front as well as backpack straps on the back, and two zipper pocket one that is perfectly sized for sheets of paper. Cost a little more than I wanted but is worth it to protect the travel guitar that I bought to abuse but ended up loving.
customer_reviews.author: John T. Plunkett IV

customer_reviews.title: Nice as described.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this bag at first. I got this bag for Yamaha APXT2 3/4 guitar. I used it every weekend to carry my guitar to the beach. It just couldn’t hold up well to the weight of the guitar and the sheet music book and other gears combined. After 9 months of use at the beach, I’m already looking for another bag...
customer_reviews.author: e.t.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great case at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a Cordoba mini scale bass. It fits perfectly. I really like the neck brace. The zippers seem sturdy. The pockets appear to be fine. The case seems well made. I'm very happy with this gig bag.
customer_reviews.author: M. Maresca

customer_reviews.title: Love Them
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these bags. I’ve ordered three (2 bass and one electric guitar) so far and am planning on ordering another for my acoustic guitar. They protect my instruments,hold them securely and have amp,e storage space for any extras you may need to take with you.
customer_reviews.author: Steph S

customer_reviews.title: Great item! Glad I purchased
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bag! Arrived quickly and was packaged very nicely. This is a very sturdy bag and is very convenient with a front zip pouch to keep music books and things that we really need. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Holly P

customer_reviews.title: Severely disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We bought this well befor Christmas as a surprise for our kids b days in January. We purchased it for a Cordova 1/2 size guitar and it barely fits. To the point someone has to hold the material together as someone else zips. Now it is to late and to return. I would not recommend this product to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This bag came as advertised. My classical guitar has an overall length of 39" and it fits fine, if not a little loosely. The bag seems heavy enough, is pretty well padded and the zippers are smooth. Two nice handles and backpack straps are also a plus. The only negative is that the stitching foam neck block and Velcro strap inside is coming undone and will need to be pinned or restiched. For the price and and the speed that it was shipped I am willing to let this slide. As for the Hola! brand, I own one of their ukueles which I have been very happy with.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan E.

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to use when I go to my guitar ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use when I go to my guitar lessons. This fits my Epiphone Les Paul standard exactly. If you have a guitar longer than a Les Paul, this gig bag will not fit you guitar. Has enough padding to protect guitar and 2 large pockets to carry picks, electric cables, tuner, a distortion and Zoom foot pedals, and a book.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Torres

customer_reviews.title: Decently priced bass case for the quality
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be pretty decent for the price. Never had a soft case that had a support and strap for the neck before. Not a big fan of the long pocket on the top but not a deal breaker either. Sufficient padding for me on straps and on the inside. Fits a Schecter Stilleto custom and an Esp LTD B204 just fine. This is for the bass case.
customer_reviews.author: Scott W. Horr

customer_reviews.title: Bass Gig Bag
customer_reviews.text: A really good value! I haven't traveled with it yet, but I can tell the material is sturdy and will stand up. I like the neck cradle - it will keep my bass secure. Good storage also. Another brand with these features would cost you more. Well done, Hola!
customer_reviews.author: Mary P.

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: It did fit my Danelectro Dano 67 which is a little difficult to fit. This updates the prior review. This gig bag has broken in to be a useful guitar carrier. It is more than padded enough for local transit from home to gig. It is doing the job nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Vince Dees

customer_reviews.title: Great gig bag for price.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this gig bag, It has a good amount of padding, neck support to keep in place, zippers are solid, good storage, and solid handles/back straps, multiple handles make it easier loading and unloading. I also have hard cases, but this is a so much easier transporting to gigs using the back straps and having your hands free to carry amps or something else. For this price, nothing else comes close.
customer_reviews.author: Grady G Wattley

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: My daughter needed a new soft-sided case for her student-sized classical guitar due to an out-of-state school trip. This case is very durable and sturdy and has room for sheet music etc. Her guitar fits snugly. This particular case would not fit s full-size acoustic, so keep that in mind. Overall a good find.
customer_reviews.author: Ouija

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic guitar case! Very high quality!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic guitar case! We purchased this for a Les Paul electric guitar, and it is perfect. It is well cushioned, and will certainly protect the guitar. The neck protection is excellent, and the guitar case is a much better quality than another higher price case we bought for our Grestch. Great value! You can’t beat the quality or price!! This item arrived quickly!
customer_reviews.author: music2jenn

customer_reviews.title: I regret this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Within one or two uses, one of the shoulder straps started tearing (see photo) and now the other one is starting to go, too. Zipper has gotten stuck a couple of times. This is one of those cheap (inexpensive) purchases that turns out to be truly cheap (crap quality). And when I tried to contact Hola Music to see what they would say ... guess what, they were unreachable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Armbruster

customer_reviews.title: Great gig bag!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this gig bag for my daughter. It arrived on time, and she loves it. Holds her SG Epiphone perfectly. And has lots of room in the pockets, she is even able to put her music book in there. And the straps are comfortable, she wears it like a back pack. I would recommend this bag. Great price and solid construction.
customer_reviews.author: craziepez

customer_reviews.title: Good case
customer_reviews.text: We are very pleased with the guitar case. My son has a lesson once a week and he was carrying a hard case and it was too difficult for him, this is a much better option. We like that the neck of the guitar is protected. He has a maestro by Gibson. We got the full size oh and we had called a local store and for a semi hard case it was double in price.
customer_reviews.author: S.K

customer_reviews.title: Superb Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: When I got my Guitar Gig Bag a couple of months ago, the bag looked well made and sturdy as advertised. Beyond the Seller's control, the main zipper had a slight defect in the bag I bought; I emailed "Hola" and the owner replied within 24 hours and within 3 days I had a new bag. Once again, I chose this bag, because in the advertisement the bag looked sturdy and well made...all true. What I wasn't expecting was the outstanding and responsive customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn & Porf

customer_reviews.title: Great brand! Second purchase....
customer_reviews.text: Last year I bought a Hola! bag for my teenage son's electric guitar. He's 15 and carries it to music lessons every week. It's held up great! I don't see any wear on it at all. So when we got our 13 year old son an acoustic guitar, this is the brand I went back to. Fantastic price for a better padded bag than most others with skimpy padding!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Far exceeds expectations. I am in love with the 3/4 guitar case. Extremely well made and cradles my guitar perfectly. The pockets can hold your picks, tuner, even a book or two. Just buy it already, you won't be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: Reese

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: for $28 you will not find a better deal in a new and well padded gig bag. nice straps and pockets. i see ppl complaining about the zippers. well they are plastic teeth, not YYZ metal zippers so dont yank too hard and you should be OK. i bought a short scale pignose bass which is about the size of most smallish to medium electric gtr and it is SUCH an upgraded gig bag to the flimsy one that came with the guitar. thanks
customer_reviews.author: Charles Victor Simpson

customer_reviews.title: when it came it was quite dirty as if somebody threw it into mods
customer_reviews.text: when it came it was quite dirty as if somebody threw it into mods!! I got it washed... But, anyways it's good
customer_reviews.author: Ella

customer_reviews.title: This bag fits the parlor size guitar.
customer_reviews.text: Its a great soft & padded 3/4 size bag. Shoulder straps for carrying it like a back pack, great for travelling. It has pockets in front enough for strings and tuners and harmonicas and music book too. A Jim Dandy parlor by Gretsch fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: PeaceLoveHazmat

customer_reviews.title: I recommend
customer_reviews.text: This case has great padding and support. Easy to carry any way you wish. I feel confident throwing my bass in this bag and tossing it in equipment trailer for a haul to a gig. Plenty of storage and your money maker is protected
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Page

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and for a very reasonable price!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, the bag can't be beat. It's better than I imagined it would be. Again, for the price, you aren't going going to find a better guitar bag. And it's fits my Fender Telecaster like a glove.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Bedell

customer_reviews.title: Great gig bag
customer_reviews.text: Wasnt sure when I ordered this but I'm pretty happy with this gig bag. Holding up nicely zippers good quality and pockets just the right size for those extras you might need
customer_reviews.author: Michael Farmer

customer_reviews.title: This bag is great It is very well padded and I am sure ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag for my Luna Safari Surpreme which I am planning to use as my travel guitar. This bag is great It is very well padded and I am sure it will protect my Luna well in the future. The pockets are very useful for books/capo...etc. Way better than the bag came with the Luna originally.
customer_reviews.author: C Lei

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY, fell apart and ruined after 3 months of use, very thin padding. not protective.
customer_reviews.text: I used the bag once a week, to go back and forth to rehearsal. When I initially purchased it in Nov 2019 I was very disappointed by the thin layer of padding, it is not protective of the instrument at all. My gut instinct wast to return it but I needed something immediately so I (regrettably) kept it. Now, 3 months later, one of the shoulder straps has ripped off, completely shredded, irreparable. I wish I would have spent the extra $ and got something better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used for one year then the zipper broke on the main accessory pocket
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bass guitar gig bag one year ago and I have to say overall I've been satisfied with it. However, the zipper broke on the main accessory pocket and now I'm in the market for a new gig bag.
customer_reviews.author: Matt F.

customer_reviews.title: Best gig bag in this price range
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several gig bags. Recently I sold most of my guitars, along with their cases and gig bags but still needed gig bags for guitars that didnt have any. I purchased this gig bag from Hola Music and let me tell you, it is high quality! I was surprised with how thick the padding is. Usually gig bags in this price range are thin and papery. This is a quality gig bag, with plenty of pockets. Fits long-scale guitars perfectly. I will be purchasing another one before they sell out
customer_reviews.author: John K

customer_reviews.title: Heck of a nice case, case closed! LOL
customer_reviews.text: Heck of a nice case. My local music shop couldn't beat the price on a similar quality case. The velcro neck bed inside the case is very smart, it keeps the guitar in position and prevents your precious ax from sliding around, plain ole gig bags don't offer the feature. Lots of room for stuff, a strap section on the outside, handles to handle any carry situation. Ok, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: ElmoJoe

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag!
customer_reviews.text: This bag fits my full size acoustic guitar perfectly. The bag is reasonably well padded and sturdy. The shoulder straps are comfortable and I also like that there are a couple of other handles on the bag, making it easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: 99eph

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE my 3/4-size Hola Classical Guitar Gig Bag.
customer_reviews.text: Well crafted in every respect, including the price! I had trepidations because a commentator on Amazon said the usable interior space was only 35 inches. I contacted Adam at the Hola Company, who assured me my 36.5" guitar would fit. It does - and easy to take out!
customer_reviews.author: W. Rosenblum

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY reccomend
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for my girlfriend. I decided to shop online for her case, because EVERYBODY in our area has the same case from the local guitar center. So now she has a slick and unique case. I must say I am jealous of the neck support this has and mine lacks even though mine was more expensive. Overall it is adequate padding and nice carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: I think this is a nice case for not being a hard shell case!
customer_reviews.text: A really nice guitar case for the price really happy with it I like the Velcro block and strap to hold the neck of the guitar nicely supported well protected extra storage pockets awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Eddy S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice electric guitar bag
customer_reviews.text: This case bag is a beautiful design with enough protection for an electric guitar. Mine is a stratocaster. There is an extra pad for the neck that gives even more support and protection to the instrument. Seller also emailed on the delivery day to ensure that the item was in optimal condition.
customer_reviews.author: Jose R.

customer_reviews.title: The Gig Bag by Hola! Music fits my full size Bass Guitar with some room to spare.
customer_reviews.text: The top notch bag came with a padded neck support and a form fitted body made with sturdy material. Enough storage space (pockets) for my sheet music and books as well as my guitar accessories ( tuners-cords-pedals(s) ) .
customer_reviews.author: RAYMOND JACKSON

customer_reviews.title: Fits my new bass electric guitar great!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this gig bag for my new bass guitar and it fits great. My only problem is that it arrived with one of the front zippers broken/unusable, but everything else is fine.
customer_reviews.author: OnoGURL

customer_reviews.title: Good people to deal with!
customer_reviews.text: These folks are a class act. Excellent communications. The gig bag is as good as they say. Very sturdy, padded and well made. Excellent value! They even ship it in a full size box rather than crumpling it up into a little 12" square box like most suppliers. My Strat style Dean fits in there perfectly. Thanks a lot Adam, family & friends! Dave in the Adirondacks
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Well made gig bag.
customer_reviews.text: This gig bag is fairly heavy duty. It has a nice neck brace for my telecaster to rest on. The padding is pretty thick, more so than my other gig bags so protection is good. I like the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Hambone99

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer!
customer_reviews.text: Simple design but looks great. I recieved my bag as I'd expected when I bought it. My Gretsch parlor guitar fits right in the bag. Also, I like that the bottom end of the bag has a rubber tread for additional guitar protection and wear protection of the bag when used standing.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold Salayon

customer_reviews.title: Nice Guitar bag
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my SG. The pad to hold the neck is extra, I wish it was softer but it serves the purpose The external pockets are spacious and can hold Picks, a few cables, tuner and strings.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Vader

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bag and a great price to boot. Someone on here said the bag looked cheap and shiny. This is not true. The bag is a matte black and I am super satisfied. Ample padding and compared to other bags in this price range I would say hands down Hola! Wins.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Melendez

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The most important thing for me in a gig bag, is a good sturdy zipper, and this certainly has that. It may not be the best gig bag ever made, but it's definitely worth trying out. For this low a price, I'd definitely recommend this bag over others.
customer_reviews.author: Dewey Decimal

customer_reviews.title: Good case
customer_reviews.text: Great case. Huge main pocket. Nice extra pocket on the neck. Nice thick padding too. Love that the zipper goes all the way around the bottom
customer_reviews.author: Barefoot

product_meta.title: Acoustic and Classical Guitars Gig Bag Full Size (41 inch) by Hola! Music, Deluxe Series with 15mm Padding, Black
feature_bullets: Don't miss the Video on the left for full description and specifications.
Fits standard Acoustic and Classical guitars up to 41 inches in length. Soft lining and a layer of reinforced padding protect the surface of your guitar from damage.
Neck support pillow distributes your guitar’s weight evenly, protecting the neck of your guitar from shocks and strain.
The heavy duty 600D Oxford Nylon fabric covering the outside, along with the hardy rubber bottom and the 12mm padding overall, give an unmatched outer layer of protection.
Comes with two pockets for picks, spare strings, and other accessories, dual adjustable shoulder straps, 2 carry handles and name window.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars996 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
